abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability highly likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Lessons drawn from the
            project indicate that even in low income environments, with
            weak regulatory capacity, profitable service can be provided
            at much higher levels, as demonstrated by the project, where
            new mobile operators have committed significant financial
            resources to the development of a state-of-the-art
            telecommunications infrastructure, and, by the unprecedented
            growth of fixed lines, and mobile subscribers. However,
            inadequate regulatory framework restricted the rapid, and
            sustainable development of competition, encountered by major
            issues, such as inadequate interconnection
            agreements/directives, high level of fees, and royalties
            levied by the Tanzania Communications Commission, and
            absence, or non-transparency of regulatory oversight.
            Additional capacity building is recommended, including the
            establishment of systems, and processes to review the
            performance of the regulatory institution. Nonetheless, due
            to the deteriorating market conditions, the privatization
            option - a capitalization process - was successful in that
            it increased the interest raised by private investors, the
            price paid for the equity stake to be sold, and sector
            development impacts, given that proceeds were reinvested to
            support investments. The public postal company proved
            efficient, and profitable, for the successful performance of
            the franchising tool, prod the development of new postal services.
